question.questionA: Trees with evergreen leaves; fruit large and fleshy.
question.questionB: Herbs or small shrubs; fruit a dry capsule.

question.questionA: Leaf margin wavy; flowers 10-15 mm; fruit 5-7 cm, globular, strongly flattened  at  each end; rind easily detachable and strongly aromatic;  flesh very sweet.
question.questionB: Leaf margin entire; flowers 20-25 mm; fruit 7 cm or more, globular, not strongly flattened at either end; rind not easily detachable.

question.questionA: Fruits pale yellow or pinkish yellow, more than 10 cm in diameter.
question.questionB: Fruits deep orange, 7-8 cm in diameter.

question.questionA: Petiole broadly winged; fruit  reddish orange; rind very bitter; flesh sour.
question.questionB: Petiole narrowly winged; fruit yellowish orange; rind only slightly bitter; flesh sweet.

question.questionA: Fruits green, without nipple-like swelling at the end.
question.questionB: Fruits yellow, with nipple-like swelling at the end.

question.questionA: Petiole wingless; flowers 2-3 cm; petals white, often flushed with pink on the outside; fruit 13-25 cm, pale yellow; rind rough; flesh mildly acidic.
question.questionB: Petiole narrowly winged; flowers 2 cm; petals white, flushed with red outside; fruit 5-10 cm, yellow; rind smooth; flesh sour.

question.questionA: Margins of petals entire or denticulate.
Leaf segments linear; flowers 10 mm in dense, terminal clusters; petals with denticulate, undulate margins.
question.questionB: Leaf segments ovate or lanceolate; flowers 15-25 mm in spreading terminal clusters; petals with entire or denticulate margins.

question.questionA: Inflorescence  glandular,  puberulent;  bracts scarcely broader than subtended branch; petals fringed with cilia longer than the width of the petal.
question.questionB: Inflorescence more or less eglandular; bracts distinctly broader than subtended branch; petals fringed with cilia shorter than the width of the petal.
